metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
With papers of 1768 [written in top margin of paper in pencil at later date]

To the Honourable and most Worthy Gentlemen assembled together to Celebrate the feast of St. Andrew --

The Humble Petition of John McKenzie a native of Scotland

Sheweth that your poor Petitioner is an old Soldier who spent his youth in Service of his King and Country and now thro old age and the many fatigues marches and Campaigns that has endured is become a totall [total] object of commiseration not being able to turn his hands to any thing for his mantinance [maintenance] by Reason of his lameness and infirmities   I have been Sick now goeing [going] on four months only for the assistance of a poor man I would have Starved for Victuals and lodging 

That Petitioner with the greatest humility beggs [begs] leave to lay his melancholly [melancholy] condition befor [before] you of Gathering himself that you will be pleased to take his case into consideration by affording him some reliefe [relief] as you allways [always] doe [do] upon Such occasions to poor people in distress and your Petitioner as in duty bound will Ever pray While I am

 Jn. Mackenzie [signature of applicant]
